required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Checklists and Upright Positioning in Endotracheal Intubation of Critically Ill Patients (Check-UP) Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Checklists and Upright Positioning in Endotracheal Intubation of Critically Ill Patients (Check-UP) Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The use of a written, pre-procedure checklist and positioning the patient with the head of the bed elevated have been proposed as interventions capable of preventing complications during non-elective intubation and are used intermittently in routine care -- however neither have been examined in a prospective trial.

detailed_description.textblock: Endotracheal intubation is common in the care of critically ill patients. Procedural complications including hypoxia and hypotension are frequent in urgent and emergent intubation and associated with an increased risk of death. The use of a written, pre-procedure checklist and positioning the patient with the head of the bed elevated have been proposed as interventions capable of preventing complications during non-elective intubation and are used intermittently in routine care -- however neither have been examined in a prospective trial. The investigators propose a randomized trial comparing use of a written checklist versus no written checklist and ramped versus sniffing position for endotracheal intubation of critically ill adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Lowest Arterial Oxygen Saturation (Both positioning and Checklist interventions)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
primary_outcome.description: Lowest non-invasively measured arterial oxygen saturation between the time of induction or neuromuscular blockade and two minutes after completion of the airway management procedure

primary_outcome.measure: Lowest Systolic Blood Pressure (Checklist intervention only)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
primary_outcome.description: Lowest non-invasively or invasively measured systolic blood pressure between medication administration and 2 minutes following successful placement of an endotracheal tube (in checklist comparison only)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Decrease in oxygen saturation of greater than 3% from induction to lowest oxygen saturation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Defined by lowest oxygen saturation less than 90% and severe hypoxemia as defined by lowest oxygen saturation less than 80%

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Change in oxygen saturation from baseline to lowest oxygen saturation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Cormack-Lehane grade of view on first intubation attempt

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Placement of an endotracheal tube in the trachea after the first insertion of the laryngoscope into the oral cavity without the use of any other devices

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts required for successful tube placement

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Time (in minutes) from pushing of induction meds to successful placement of endotracheal tube

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of need for additional intubating equipment, second operator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of non-oxygenation complications - composite of all other recorded complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of post-intubation tube malposition on Chest X-Ray (CXR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of Induction through 2 minutes after successful intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of repositioning patient after procedure initiation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment through the earlier of hospital discharge or 365 days

secondary_outcome.description: Days alive and free from mechanical ventilation
Days alive and out of the ICU

arm_group.description: Patient in the sniffing position without the use of a written checklist
Patient in the sniffing position with the use of a written checklist

arm_group.arm_group_label: Head of Bed Up, No Checklist
arm_group.description: Patient with the head of bed up and without the use of a checklist
Patient with the head of bed up and with the use of a checklist

intervention.description: Use of a written checklist pre and peri-intubation
Raising the patient's head of bed to 25 degrees
intervention.arm_group_label: Head of Bed Up, No Checklist

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Airway management events will be included in which:
1. Patient is admitted to the Medical Intensive Care Unit (MICU)
2. Planned procedure is endotracheal intubation
3. Planned operator is a Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine (PCCM) fellow
4. Administration of sedation and/or neuromuscular blockade is planned
5. Age â‰¥ 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
Airway management events will be excluded in which:
1. Operator feels specific patient positioning during intubation is required
2. Urgency of intubation precludes safe performance of study procedures
3. Operator feels an alternative pre-procedure checklist or no checklist is required

facility.name: Louisiana State University School of Medicine
